history.content:
Did you take all 3 classes in one semester? If not, don't beat yourself up over a bad grade, it happens. Talk to the advisors next semester. Don't give up

Talk with advisors as soon as second semester starts (I believe they're all on break currently).

children.subject:
Thank you Anon! No, I took 61A over the summer and CS 61B and 70 during fall. I'm willing to retake either of these classes and I'm confident I can earn As in them. Unfortunately, I got a B and B+ so I can't retake them.

I'll talk to the advisors. Do you have any personal experience or advice for me? Thanks (wo)man.
What do you mean? what is tfti

Quoted from Urban Dictionary:

"an acronym for Thanks For The Invite, usually used when a bunch of your buddies go out and they dont think to invite you "
+1 how do u get past interviews without being able to get decent grades in these classes? Genuinely curious cause I've been having a lot of trouble
They didn't care at all about my GPA. I didn't put it on my resume and they didn't even ask about it.
No I didn't mean based on GPA, I meant based on skill level. I feel like the level of difficulty for most interviews are at least at or above the level of difficulty of these classes
I put in the time to develop my knowledge and it paid off!
How did you prepare for the interviews? If you don't mind me asking

Not OP here, but I'm in a similar situation. Got 2 offers from Big 4 companies but got Bs in CS classes. I did it by working though "Cracking the Coding Interview," doing online coding practices, and asking a lot of mentors to sit down with me and do mock interviews (and it paid off-- all the interviews were about that stuff, and one interview question was almost exactly the same as a mock interview question). Tl; dr cracking the coding interview and lots, lots, lots of daily practice. Imo I did bad in classes because I had a hard time keeping up with all of them at once, but I did ok in interviews because it was a single assessment and I was lucky to be prepared. Also I got a variation of Fizzbuzz as an interview question and couldn't believe my ears.
How did you even get to the interview stage? As a 4.0 student with quite a few projects, especially for a freshman, it's disconcerting to get rejected even without an interview.

history.content: Not sure if I just responded to your email. My advice is make sure you submitted the personal statement, and wait until decisions come out.

I'm wondering if I have any chance of getting into CS with a 3.1 GPA. I choked on one final and my dreams burned.

I love CS, in fact, I studied in community college for a year in high school to take more CS classes. I've interviewed onsite at a Big 4 tech company. I am a freshman.

Any advice? What's the process like?
